page.title: 06GOONHILLY NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The study block contains a section of most interesting heathland on the edge of the larger Goonhilly Downs. The majority of the Downs is now controlled by the Nature Conservancy Council (NCC) and has been designated a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI). It is of importance for its unique communities of plants and for the fact that it is one of the few lowland heaths remaining in the Southwest. The heathland is a sub-climax vegetation area maintained by burning,grazing and 'furze cutting'.Much of its value to the local people goes back to the 1700s onwards when the area was croft farmed and small communities used it to eke out a living. Gorse was cut as a source of fuel, a practise which ceased about 50 years ago. contd...
